content:
To protect your horse from tick-borne illnesses, you should take the following preventive measures:

1. Regularly check your horse's fur and skin for ticks, especially during peak tick season.

2. Use a tick repellent spray made specifically for horses.

3. Keep your horse's environment clean and free of debris that could attract ticks.

4. Remove any livestock attractants from the area around your horse's environment.

5. Maintain a healthy immune system in your horse through proper nutrition and health care.

6. Have your horse checked regularly by a veterinarian to identify and treat any tick-borne illnesses early.

By following these precautions, you can significantly reduce your horse's risk of contracting tick-borne illnesses.
